intro: Glinus lotoides subsp. hirtus, commonly known as hairy glinus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and grasslands. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
